abstract: Nearly six million Facebook members signed up for personalized Web addresses after the feature became available on Friday.
snippet: Nearly six million Facebook members signed up for personalized Web addresses after the feature became available on Friday.
lead_paragraph: Update | June 16, 8:11 a.m.  Removed reference to Facebook not reserving Web addresses for Times reporters. Facebook says it did reserve custom addresses for a number of reporters covering Facebook, including a Times reporter.

headline.main: Celebrity, Product and Joke Names Grabbed as Facebook Vanity URLs
